identificationModule.briefTitle: [18F]FAraG PET Imaging for Analysis of Biodistribution in Cancer Patients Expected to Undergo Immunotherapy and/or Radiation Therapy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Study of the Kinetics, Dosimetry and Safety of [18F]F-AraG (VisAcT), a Positron Emission Tomography Tracer for Imaging the Activation of the Immune System in Cancer Patients Who Have Received or Are Expected to Receive Immunotherapy and/or Radiation Therapy

collaborators.name: UCSF Imaging Center at China Basin

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a Phase 1 study is to visualize biodistribution of a PET tracer called \[18F\]F-AraG (VisAcT) in cancer patients expected to undergo immunotherapy and/or radiation therapy.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is an exploratory Phase 1, prospective study assessing the biodistribution and radiation dosimetry of the Positron Emission Tomography \[18F\]FAraG (VisAcT) in cancer patients selected for immunotherapy and/or radiation therapy. Each patient may have up to two \[ 18F\]FAraG PET imaging sessions, a baseline scan and a post start of immunotherapy scan. For each imaging session, patients will receive a single injection of \[18F\]FAraG and undergo a whole-body PET scans an hour after injection of the tracer. Following each imaging session, the patient will be called within 72 hours to note any side effects.

Optional - Blood samples may be collected at up to 9 time points post-injection to analyze whole-blood/plasma time activity of \[18F\]FAraG in addition an urine sample may be collected post scan.

interventions.name: [18F]F-AraG
interventions.description: Single dose IV injection of \[18F\]F-AraG for each imaging day.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Visualize biodistribution of the PET tracer [18F]F-AraG pre-immunotherapy
primaryOutcomes.description: Whole-body \[18F\]F-AraG PET scan will be performed after intravenous injection of the PET tracer.consecutive time points the day of the intravenous injection of the PET tracer.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 6 weeks before immunotherapy is administered

primaryOutcomes.measure: Visualize biodistribution of the PET tracer [18F]F-AraG post start of immunotherapy
primaryOutcomes.description: Whole-body \[18F\]F-AraG PET scan will be performed after intravenous injection of the PET tracer.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 12 weeks after start of immunotherapy

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Cancer patients with identified tumor mass
* Cancer patients expected to undergo immunotherapy and/or radiation therapy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Under the age of 18
* Pregnant women
* Women who are breastfeeding
* Individuals with known or suspected substance abuse
* Individuals unable or unwilling to comply with the study procedures

overallOfficials.name: Robert R Flavell, M.D., Ph.D.
overallOfficials.affiliation: UCSF Department of Radiology & Biomedical Imaging

locations.facility: UCSF Imaging Center at China Basin
